byteremote.common.socket.udp

Class UDPSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • byteremote.common.socket.udp.UDPSocket

  • public class UDPSocket
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a wrapper for java.net.DatagramSocket Every single UDPSocket.receive() corresponds to a single UDPSocket.send()

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(byte[] message,
                 java.lang.String ip,
                 int port)
          throws UDPSocketException
        Method used to send a message to the specified address
        Parameters:
        message - - Message to be sent
        ip - - The ip address
        port - - The port address
        Throws:
        UDPSocketException - - in case of error

      • receive

        public byte[] receive()
               throws UDPSocketException
        Method that return a message received on the port specified at the construct time.
        Every UDPSocket.receive() corresponds to UDPSocket.send(message).

        Flow:
          receive [handshake_id][nrPackets] - send [handshake_id][nrPackets]
          foreach packet: receive [data_id][packet]

        Returns:
        byte[] - Message
        Throws:
        UDPSocketException - - in case of error

      • setDataTimeOut

        public void setDataTimeOut(int timeOut)
        Set timeout for waiting a data packet. By default the timeout is 500ms and it can be changed in order to fit better in a poor/good connection environment.
        Parameters:
        timeOut - wanted timeout

      • getLastPort

        public int getLastPort()
        Get the last port received
        Returns:
        Last port received

      • getLastIp

        public java.lang.String getLastIp()
        Get the last ip received
        Returns:
        Last ip received

      • isBound

        public boolean isBound()
        Returns the binding state of the socket.
        Returns:
        true if the socket successfully bound to an address

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns whether the socket is closed or not.
        Returns:
        true if the socket has been closed

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the datagram socket associated with this socket.
